item.title: product design: a water bottle for a cybersecurity company
item.description: This is my take on the following prompt: We are required to design a branded water bottle for a cybersecurity company. First, let’s understand why we are designing this product (apart from the most generic reason: for employees to drink water from =] ) People love brand merch, especially when it’s their own company. It promotes a sense of loyalty to the company, team spirit, and makes them feel like they’re a part of the bigger picture (a company has made it big when its employees want to flaunt company swag) Most of our employees sit at a desk all day long — it’s important to stay hydrated Zero-effort marketing — you see an employee drinking from a branded water bottle in the metro, you are made aware of this super cool xyz company.

item.title: RCA: Uber's rides from RGIA have dropped by 50% in the last week
item.description: Photo by Dan Gold on Unsplash This is my attempt at a root-cause analysis on the following problem statement: Uber’s rides from RGIA have dropped by 50% over the last week. Diagnose the problem. 50% is a massive number. Our first check will be on the metrics: Are we getting the correct metrics on our dashboard? Is there any technical hitch which may be causing incorrect data to appear?
